title: Shipped Ora Health AI Weekly Planning System
content:
Built a complete push notification + AI weekly planning system for Ora Health tonight. 1:00-1:30 AM. 30 minutes of flow state.

What shipped:
- Agent memory service (recalls meditation history, mood, community context)
- Weekly planning system (Claude Sonnet 4 personalized prompts every Sunday 9 AM)
- Weekly review system (AI analysis comparing plan vs reality, Sunday 6 PM)
- Notification graphics service (Gemini Imagen integration)
- 8 new API endpoints
- 6 database tables
- 3 new UI screens
- 2 cron jobs

~2,500 lines of code. 17 backend files, 5 frontend files. Production ready.

The idea: turn Ora Health from a meditation app into an AI coach that actually remembers your journey. It knows what you've meditated on, how you've been feeling, what you've shared in the community. Every Sunday morning it asks about your week ahead with personalized context. Sunday evening it reflects with you on what actually happened.

Singleton services, SQL CTEs for complex queries, timezone-aware cron, Expo push notifications, Claude Sonnet 4 for the personalization engine.

Database verification passed. All tables created. Services working. Just needs Expo project config and real user testing.

The unsexy truth about shipping: most of it is wiring. Authentication, database migrations, cron scheduling, error handling, environment variables, API contracts. The AI prompt is 50 lines. The infrastructure to deliver it reliably is 2,500.

But when it works? Users wake up Sunday morning to a notification that feels like their meditation app actually knows them. That's the payoff.
